definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to throw off the reins/runaway (horse)/fig. out of control
lit. a horse that has thrown off the reins (idiom); runaway horse/out of control
lit. fettered by fame and locked up by riches (idiom); tied down by reputation and wealth/the victim of one's own success
a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)

sentences.english: In the chess, the horses and generals can't fight.
sentences.chinese: 棋盘里，车无轮马无缰，叫声将军提防提防。

sentences.english: After injection into the rostral or caudal pole of the IPN, no labeled cells were observed in bilateral medial habenular nuclei.
sentences.chinese: 双侧缰内侧核纤维并不投射至脚间核的吻端和尾端。

sentences.english: The horse is broken to the bridle.

sentences.chinese: 把缰收短一点，然后再试一次。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid that I shall try to escape. Here, tie this rope round your neck and fasten it to my bridle.
sentences.chinese: 把这条粗绳绑在你的脖子上并且系紧在马缰上面。

sentences.english: This way, your seat and rein aids will be quite powerful.
sentences.chinese: 骑坐和缰联系将会十分有力。

sentences.english: To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.
sentences.chinese: 爱人和被人爱是韰腛缰人生最大的幸福。

sentences.english: Never tie by the bridle, either using the reins or tying the bit.
sentences.chinese: 从不栓马笼头，也不可栓缰或短距离拴马。

definition: to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
to throw off the reins/runaway (horse)/fig. out of control
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)
